page.title: 15LITTLE BADDOW CANAL-2
page.content: After 1975 the Chelmer and Blackwater Company of Proprietors took over the canal for the purpose of tourism. A pleasure cruiser was the first boat acquired for public use and since then many pleasure cruisers and small power boats can be found along the canal. There are sufficient facilities for the mooring of extra boats. During the summer months the public can hire a boat for one day or a period of weeks and enjoy a trip travelling through the beautiful Essex countryside. The section of the Navigation which runs through Little Baddow is to the north of the village and stretches over an area of 4-5km. In this section is one lock, Paper Mill Lock. It was the site of two mills and the barge horse stables have recently been restored to their working state.
